snippet: When America has pushed for new leaders in global hot spots, it has often turned out badly. But that isn’t an argument for withdrawing from involvement abroad.
abstract: Editorial warns that there should be no illusion that Iraqi Pres Haider al-Abadi will quickly end country's crises, just because Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki agrees to step down; notes that history of American-backed regime changes is rife with failures.
lead_paragraph: When America has pushed for new leaders in global hot spots, it has often turned out badly. But that isn’t an argument for withdrawing from involvement abroad.

headline.main: Maliki and the Futility of Regime Change
headline.print_headline: Maliki and the Futility of Regime Change

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
